content.text: Help me set up hypertransparency for my project.
content.textPreview: Help me set up hypertransparency for my project.

messages.searchText: help me set up hypertransparency for my project

content.text:
I'll help you set up hypertransparency to document your AI-assisted development process.

**Step 1: Install**

```bash
pip install git+https://github.com/bbdaniels/hypertransparency.git
```

**Step 2: Initialize**

```bash
cd /path/to/your/repo
hypertransparency init
```

This creates a `.hypertransparency.json` config file.

messages.searchText: help you set up hypertransparency pip install initialization

content.text:
Building the documentation site...

```bash
hypertransparency build
```

The site has been generated in the `docs/` folder. You can:

1. **Preview locally:** `hypertransparency serve`
2. **Deploy to GitHub Pages:** Push the `docs/` folder to your repo

content.text: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed.
